DIRTYCODE_API int32_t CommTCPConnect ( CommTCPRef *  ref,
const char *  addr 
)

Initiate a connection to a peer.

Parameters
*ref- reference pointer
*addr- address in ip-address:port form
Returns
int32_t - negative=error, zero=ok
Note
Does not currently perform dns translation
Version
1.0 02/19/99 (GWS) First Version

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t CommTCPResolve ( CommTCPRef *  ref,
const char *  addr,
char *  buf,
int32_t  len,
char  div 
)

Resolve an address.

Parameters
*ref- endpoint
*addr- resolve address
*buf- target buffer
len- target length (min 64 bytes)
div- divider char
Returns
int32_t - <0=error, 0=complete (COMM_NOERROR), >0=in progress (COMM_PENDING)
Note
Target list is always double null terminated allowing null to be used as the divider character if desired. when COMM_PENDING is returned, target buffer is set to "~" until completion
Version
1.0 02/19/99 (GWS) First Version

References NetPrintf.

Referenced by CommTCPConstruct().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t CommTCPSend ( CommTCPRef *  ref,
const void *  buffer,
int32_t  length,
uint32_t  flags 
)

Send a packet.

Parameters
*ref- reference pointer
*buffer- pointer to data
length- length of data
flags- COMM_FLAGS_*
Returns
int32_t - negative=error, zero=buffer full (temp fail), positive=queue position (ok)
Note
Zero length packets may not be sent (they are used for buffer query)
Version
1.0 02/19/99 (GWS) First Version

References RawTCPPacketT::body, COMM_BADSTATE, COMM_MINBUFFER, RawTCPPacketT::data, ds_memcpy(), RawTCPPacketT::head, RawTCPPacketT::len, NetPrintf, NetTick(), CommTCPRef::sndbuf, CommTCPRef::sndinp, CommTCPRef::sndlen, CommTCPRef::sndout, CommTCPRef::sndwid, CommTCPRef::socket, CommTCPRef::state, and RawTCPPacketT::when.

Referenced by CommTCPConstruct().
